speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: SCENE IV. A nunnery.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Enter ISABELLA and FRANCISCA

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And have you nuns no farther privileges?

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Are not these large enough?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yes, truly; I speak not as desiring more;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But rather wishing a more strict restraint

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Upon the sisterhood, the votarists of Saint Clare.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Within]  Ho! Peace be in this place!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Who's that which calls?

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: It is a man's voice. Gentle Isabella,

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Turn you the key, and know his business of him;

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: You may, I may not; you are yet unsworn.

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: When you have vow'd, you must not speak with men

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: But in the presence of the prioress:

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Then, if you speak, you must not show your face,

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Or, if you show your face, you must not speak.

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: He calls again; I pray you, answer him.

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Peace and prosperity! Who is't that calls

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Enter LUCIO

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Hail, virgin, if you be, as those cheek-roses

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Proclaim you are no less! Can you so stead me

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As bring me to the sight of Isabella,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: A novice of this place and the fair sister

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To her unhappy brother Claudio?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Why 'her unhappy brother'? let me ask,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The rather for I now must make you know

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I am that Isabella and his sister.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Gentle and fair, your brother kindly greets you:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Not to be weary with you, he's in prison.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Woe me! for what?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: For that which, if myself might be his judge,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He should receive his punishment in thanks:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He hath got his friend with child.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Sir, make me not your story.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: It is true.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I would not--though 'tis my familiar sin

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: With maids to seem the lapwing and to jest,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Tongue far from heart--play with all virgins so:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I hold you as a thing ensky'd and sainted.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: By your renouncement an immortal spirit,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And to be talk'd with in sincerity,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As with a saint.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: You do blaspheme the good in mocking me.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Do not believe it. Fewness and truth, 'tis thus:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Your brother and his lover have embraced:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As those that feed grow full, as blossoming time

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: That from the seedness the bare fallow brings

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To teeming foison, even so her plenteous womb

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Expresseth his full tilth and husbandry.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Some one with child by him? My cousin Juliet?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Is she your cousin?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Adoptedly; as school-maids change their names

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: By vain though apt affection.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: She it is.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, let him marry her.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: This is the point.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: The duke is very strangely gone from hence;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Bore many gentlemen, myself being one,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: In hand and hope of action: but we do learn

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: By those that know the very nerves of state,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: His givings-out were of an infinite distance

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: From his true-meant design. Upon his place,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And with full line of his authority,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Governs Lord Angelo; a man whose blood

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Is very snow-broth; one who never feels

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: The wanton stings and motions of the sense,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: But doth rebate and blunt his natural edge

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: With profits of the mind, study and fast.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He--to give fear to use and liberty,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Which have for long run by the hideous law,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As mice by lions--hath pick'd out an act,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Under whose heavy sense your brother's life

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Falls into forfeit: he arrests him on it;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And follows close the rigour of the statute,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To make him an example. All hope is gone,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Unless you have the grace by your fair prayer

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To soften Angelo: and that's my pith of business

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: 'Twixt you and your poor brother.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Doth he so seek his life?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Has censured him

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Already; and, as I hear, the provost hath

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: A warrant for his execution.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Alas! what poor ability's in me

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To do him good?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Assay the power you have.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: My power? Alas, I doubt--

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Our doubts are traitors

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And make us lose the good we oft might win

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: By fearing to attempt. Go to Lord Angelo,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And let him learn to know, when maidens sue,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Men give like gods; but when they weep and kneel,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: All their petitions are as freely theirs

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As they themselves would owe them.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'll see what I can do.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: But speedily.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I will about it straight;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: No longer staying but to give the mother

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Notice of my affair. I humbly thank you:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Commend me to my brother: soon at night

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'll send him certain word of my success.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I take my leave of you.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Good sir, adieu.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Exeunt
